title: January 6th Committee
added: Also on October 7, ''[[Politico]]'' and [[Bloomberg News]] reported seeing a letter from a Trump attorney to the four Trump associates subpoenaed on September 23, instructing to not comply.<ref>https://www.politico.com/news/2021/10/07/trump-jan-6-committees-subpoena-515593</ref><ref>https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-07/trump-instructs-former-aides-to-defy-jan-6-panel-subpoenas</ref>

title: January 6th Committee
added: Also on October 7, ''[[Politico]]'' and [[Bloomberg News]] reported seeing a letter from a Trump attorney to the four Trump associates subpoenaed on September 23, instructingthemto not comply.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/10/07/trump-jan-6-committees-subpoena-515593|title=Trump tells 4 former aides to defy Jan. 6 committee's subpoena|first=Betsy Woodruff|last=Swan|website=POLITICO}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Trump Instructs Former Aides to Defy Jan. 6 Panel Subpoenas |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-07/trump-instructs-former-aides-to-defy-jan-6-panel-subpoenas |publisher=Bloomberg News |date=October 7, 2021|author1=Billy House|author2=Mario Parker}}</ref>

title: January 6th Committee
added: After Bannon informed the Committee in an October 8 letter that he would not cooperate with the investigation, the Committee immediately announced it would "swiftly consider" initiating criminal contempt of Congress proceedings. Bannon's attorney said his client was refusing to comply on the basis of Trump's assertion of executive privilege. Meadows and Patel had communicated with the Committee, while Scavino had not been located to be served with his subpoena.<ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/08/us/politics/steve-bannon-capitol-riot.html</ref>

title: January 6th Committee
added: After Bannon informed the Committee in an October 8 letter that he would not cooperate with the investigation, the Committee immediately announced it would "swiftly consider" initiating criminal contempt of Congress proceedings. Bannon's attorney said his client was refusing to comply on the basis of Trump's assertion of executive privilege. Meadows and Patel had communicated with the Committee, while Scavino had not been located to be served with his subpoena.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/08/us/politics/steve-bannon-capitol-riot.html|title=Jan. 6 Panel Threatens to Pursue Charges Against Bannon|first1=Maggie|last1=Haberman|first2=Luke|last2=Broadwater|date=October 8, 2021|via=NYTimes.com}}</ref>
